newsitem.title: USA: Medaphis to restate 1995 loss larger.
newsitem.headline: Medaphis to restate 1995 loss larger.

text.p: Medaphis Corp said Tuesday it plans to restate its results for the year and three months ended December 21, 1995, leading to a net loss for the year of $8.5 million compared with the previously reported net loss of $3.4 million.
Restated results for the quarter ended December 31, 1995, will reflect a net loss of $1.1 million, as compared with previously reported net income of $4.0 million, the company said.

The company said it was restating the results largely because of a license agreement entered into by Imonics in December 1995, and unauthorized correspondence discovered in connection with the Imonics reorganization which created a contingency upon license fees payable under the agreement.

"The reorganization of Imonics has been difficult, especially the discovery of the unauthorized correspondence which led us to the conclusion to restate our 1995 results," company Chief Executive Randolph Brown said in a statement.
The company did not immediately return a telephone call.
